text:
We launched <https://producthunt.com/posts/learning-dollars-talent>.

Seeking feedback from teams who want to try *LD Talent*, a project born out of Stanford University. It's a tool that helps you find vetted, diverse, and highly productive developers. The platform gives you <http://ldtalent.org/#pricing|~5 free hours> to try them before hiring them for <http://ldtalent.org/#pricing|contract or full-time> roles. Build your MVP, v2, etc. (<http://calendly.com/learningdollars/all-appointments|appointments calendar>). To see how incredibly unique LD is, check out these video clips:
• [~1m] an <https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuEKqJbm9O8?start=0&end=70|overview> of the platform and vetting
• [~30s] <https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuEKqJbm9O8?start=832&end=865|transparent work sessions>
• [~1m] <https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuEKqJbm9O8?start=185&end=285|data on developers>, i.e. productivity and responsiveness
• [~3m] <https://youtu.be/Ize-Gxaalgw?t=113|interviewing tips and time estimation>
• [~1m] <https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuEKqJbm9O8?start=924&end=1007|budget control>
*Diversity meets Capitalism:* Our mission is to help teams drop<https://blog.learningdollars.com/2019/11/17/how-to-end-world-poverty-and-racial-power-imbalance-in-1-generation/| location constraints> that unknowingly and implicitly overlook qualified, motivated, and<https://blog.learningdollars.com/2020/03/31/developer-time-tracking-using-slack-beyond-fixed-price-vs-hourly/| efficient> underrepresented people from roles they're perfect for. Given the rise of<https://blog.learningdollars.com/2020/04/17/100-remote-startup-mantras/| remote distributed teams> in the new normal, we believe that global collaborations are the future.
<@U02G4072KGQ> interesting idea! I'm sure there will be a lot of people looking for something like this. I noticed that HubSpot isn't listed in your skills list - is it on the roadmap to get added?
